item.title: Stardew Valley: How to Unlock & Get Queen Of Sauce Cookbook
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock And Get The Queen of Sauce Cookbook
  • How To Get and Use The Queen of Sauce Cookbook

In Stardew Valley , cooked meals not only make an excellent gift for villagers, but they also provide an instant boost to your energy levels. However, you’ll need to learn the recipe for each meal before you can cook them. You can watch The Queen of Sauce TV show to learn a new recipe each week or receive them in the mail from villagers. If you’d rather skip the grind, you can purchase the Queen of Sauce Cookbook.

Introduced in Stardew Valley 1.6, the Queen of Sauce Cookbook is a must-have for all players. This unique book unlocks all the recipes you would otherwise learn from watching the Queen of Sauce cooking show. This allows you to cook a huge variety of dishes immediately in Stardew Valley . Read on to learn how you can unlock the Queen of Sauce Cookbook and read it in Stardew Valley .

How To Unlock And Get The Queen of Sauce Cookbook

Before you can purchase the Queen of Sauce Cookbook, you must first unlock it by finding at least 100 Golden Walnuts in Ginger Island. Here’s a quick rundown of everything you need to do to unlock the Queen of Sauce Cookbook:

  1. Complete the Main Questline: Finish either the Community Center restoration or the Joja Community Development path.
  2. Repair Willy's Boat: Restore Willy's boat to access Ginger Island.
  3. Explore Ginger Island: Once you can travel to Ginger Island, begin exploring.
  4. Collect 100 Golden Walnut : Gather 100 Golden Walnuts throughout Ginger Island. These can be found in various locations, such as treasure chests, completing quests, and fishing.

Since this isn’t an easy task, the Queen of Sauce Cookbook becomes available only after reaching the late-game stages. However, once you collect 100 Golden Walnuts, the cookbook will always be purchasable from the Bookseller in Stardew Valley .

How To Get and Use The Queen of Sauce Cookbook

The Queen Of Sauce Cookbook is exclusively available for purchase from the Bookseller, who charges a hefty 50,000g for it. You can find the Bookseller in a raised clearing north of Joja Mart. The Bookseller makes two visits to town each season, and their arrival is always indicated on the calendar by a hot air balloon icon.

You’ll also receive a notification upon waking up informing you that the Bookseller is in town.

Once you purchase the Queen of Sauce Cookbook, you can read it like other skill books in Stardew Valley . Reading the cookbook grants you all the recipes you haven't yet learned from the "Queen of Sauce" TV show. If you haven’t watched all the episodes of the show, the Cookbook is a great way to quickly learn all the recipes you might have missed.

item.title: Endless Legend 2 Finally Revealed
item.description:
Summary

  • 4X strategy game Endless Legend 2 has been announced.
  • The Endless Legend sequel is launching in early access in early 2025.
  • Fans can already sign up for a pre-release playtest, which will comprise multiple phases and aim to include as many applicants as possible.

Following years' worth of fan anticipation, Endless Legend 2 is finally official. The Endless Legend sequel has been revealed with a two-minute trailer and the promise of a near-future release, preceded by a multi-stage playtest.

Developed by France-based Amplitude Studios, Endless Legend was released in September 2014 to positive reactions, as underlined by its "Mighty" rating on OpenCritic, based on an average score of 84 and an 86% reviewer recommendation rate. Critics and players alike praised its innovative blend of gameplay mechanics and intricate lore, in addition to touting Endless Legend as one of the most hardcore grand strategy games ever made.

More than ten years later, Amplitude Studios announced Endless Legend 2 with an extended trailer that premiered in late January 2025. The game can currently be wishlisted on Steam but doesn't yet have a firm release date, though it's planned to debut sometime in early 2025. While the original Endless Legend was published by Iceberg Interactive and later Sega, the sequel will be distributed by Manor Lords publisher Hooded Horse.

Endless Legend 2 Will Feature a New World, Factions, and More

The upcoming title will take place in Saiadha, an oceanic world described as both pretty and perilous. The gameplay loop of Endless Legend 2 was designed around the game's setting, with Amplitude confirming the existence of storm and tide mechanics requiring players to adapt to constantly shifting environmental conditions. The game will expand the series' complicated lore with new factions, ancient civilizations, and secrets, among other novelties. The early access version of Endless Legend 2 will have four playable factions, with Amplitude planning to add two more post-release. As was the case with the first game, each EL2 faction will feature a unique playstyle. Amplitude has hinted that the day-one factions will allow players to choose between warriors, nobles, diplomats, and builders.

Endless Legend 2 Playtest Is Starting Soon

Ahead of its Steam Early Access launch, Endless Legend 2 will host a closed playtest. Enrollment will be managed via Amplitude's newly reopened Insiders program. Anyone wanting to register for a chance to be among the first to try the game can do so by filling out a short survey. The details of the Endless Legend 2 playtest will be announced at a later date. Amplitude says it intends to include "as many players as possible," while noting that not all applicants may be selected for every phase of the test.

How To Register For Endless Legend 2 Playtest

  1. Fill out Amplitude's survey.
  2. Wait for a follow-up email confirming or rejecting enrollment "in the next few weeks."

It's presently unclear how long Endless Legend 2 is planned to remain in early access. Regardless, given the near-universal acclaim of its predecessor, this is a title that fans of strategy games will want to keep an eye on in 2025.

item.title: Call of Duty Fans Want One Zombies Feature to Return
item.description:
Summary

  • Call of Duty fans want Black Ops 6 to bring back Black Ops 2's comic book-style Zombies loading screens.
  • Some players believe Black Ops 6's current loading screens aren't as aesthetically pleasing or unique compared to those from Black Ops 2.
  • Black Ops 6 Season 2 will introduce a new Zombies map called "The Tomb" and additional content, but comic-style loading screens seem unlikely.

Call of Duty fans recently voiced their desire for Call of Duty: Black Ops 2's comic book-style Zombies loading screens to make a return in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . The community also shared their thoughts on the loading screens that are currently available in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , including those unlocked by entering Prestige.

Once Black Ops 6 Season 2 begins on January 28, the game will have a total of four Zombies maps with the introduction of "The Tomb." The map continues from where the main story of Citadelle des Morts left off as the Zombies crew searches for the Sentinel Artifact in its depths. Before the second season begins, Zombies fans began to look back at Black Ops 2 and some of its beloved features, including the loading screens.

Reddit user CompleteFacepalm would like to see comic book-style loading screens from Black Ops 2 return for Black Ops 6 Zombies. Many players in the Black Ops 6 community on Reddit, including Osada_Ueyko, aren't happy with the loading screens that players can currently unlock, noting that the loading screen illustrations don't have enough artistic substance or look "horrible" due to scaling at higher resolutions. Others believe Black Ops 2 Zombies loading screens were more aesthetically pleasing and consistent across all maps, including the fan-favorite Buried map. Fans in the community are also doubtful about any changes to loading screens in future Black Ops 6 updates, with some believing that Activision and Treyarch would rather work on all-new operator skins and bundles instead of making loading screens that Zombies fans would want.

Call of Duty Fans Want Black Ops 2's Zombies Comic Book Loading Screens to Return in Black Ops 6

Currently, Black Ops 6 players can earn new loading screens by completing challenges, reaching certain Prestige levels, leveling up the Battle Pass, and purchasing bundles like Tracer Packs from the in-game shop. None of the available loading screens in Black Ops 6 Season 1 replicate the comic book aesthetic that some Zombies fans have been wanting, however. Black Ops 6's Prestige loading screens reference past Black Ops games, and there could still be a chance for loading screens referencing older Zombies maps to appear in a future update if fans continue to be vocal and send feedback.

The Season 2 update will add a slew of new content alongside The Tomb map for Black Ops 6 Zombies. Players can expect new multiplayer maps, new weapons and gear, the Season 2 Battle Pass, and additional challenges and limited-time events. Although comic book-style loading screens don't appear to be on the cards for Black Ops 6 , players can expect a steady flow of updates and content in Season 2 and beyond.

The best Runic Summons in God of War Ragnarok will provide Kratos with the assistance he needs to battle it out with some of the hardest foes across the Nine Realms, but it's not just Atreus who brings an interesting set of Runic Summons this time around.

Both Atreus and Freya have 4 Runic Summons, and each of them offers a unique advantage during combat to help keep Kratos in the fight, maximizing aggressive playstyles and complimenting gameplay well while never getting in the way. Players can find every Runic Summon in God of War Ragnarok below, as well as what they do and how powerful they can be.

Updated on January 26, 2025, by Jake Fillery: God of War Ragnarok's best Runic Summons are entirely dependent on the playstyle of each gamer. While there is a notable difference between them all, it's worth being aware of the fact that both Atreus and Freya have 4 Runic Summons each, and their upgrade stats, damage stats, and where to find them, can all be found below so that players can better understand the best Runic Summons in God of War Ragnarok for their builds.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Player Points Out Helpful Settings Change
item.description:
Summary

  • To enhance gameplay in Marvel Rivals, disable automatic web-swinging for Venom and Spider-Man in settings.
  • Enable teammate health bars when playing support and tank characters for situational awareness.
  • Activate the KO sound cue option to differentiate between ally and enemy takedowns.

The chaotic nature of hero shooters like Marvel Rivals , with its fast pace and large number of visual effects, can make it difficult to keep track of developments during the match. Because of this, Marvel Rivals players often share gameplay and settings tips to improve performance and situational awareness.

For Venom and Spider-Man mains to better dominate the battlefield, one golden tip is to disable the automatic web-swinging option in the Marvel Rivals settings. With this turned off, players can better control the mobility of the two heroes, making traversal less chaotic. For Strategist and Vanguard players, the game's support and tanks, enabling the health bars of allies is an essential setting for highlighting nearby players who need protection.

This time, Redditor pxp121kr has shared a valuable tip for Marvel Rivals players, allowing them to hear a sound when allies and enemies are downed. They explain that to activate the setting, players need to navigate to the “audio” tab in the settings menu, and then select the combat mix tab. Scrolling down the page, players will find the option “KO sound cue.” Players should check the box for both ally and enemy knockdowns in adition to adjusting the volume to taste. Some players expressed surprised that they didn't know about this option, and others were perplexed that it wasn't enabled by default. After all, this is an important tool for identifying when it's time to retreat or press onward during team fights.

How to Activate the KO Sound Cue Option in Marvel Rivals

  • Go to the Setting menu in Marvel Rivals.
  • Select the Audio section and then the Combat Mix section.
  • Under “KO Sound Cue,” select the checkboxes for the options: Announce when a teammate is KO'd, and Announce enemy KO.

Meanwhile, other comments gave extra information, explaining that the sound cue emits a “happy sound” when an opponent is downed, and a “sad sound” when a teammate is killed, helping to distinguish the difference between the two. One player entered a quickplay match to test the setting and said that, for them, the difference was “like night and day.” However, other comments would have liked the sound cue to be louder. More comments said that, despite the differences between Marvel Rivals and Overwatch 2 , NetEase's game should have a feature similar to Blizzard's shooter: a warning in chat when a player changes characters.

Marvel Rivals was released just over a month ago and has been a huge hit with players, pitting Marvel heroes and villains in 6v6 matches with maps inspired by the House of Ideas lore. Despite this, the community has often noticed points where the game needs to improve to deliver a better player experience. With Marvel Rivals receiving updates periodically, fans wait to see what quality-of-life options may arrive in future patches.
